column4: Stifel  SEC reach deal over Wisconsin school investments
column5: Stifel Financial Corp's  brokerage unit has reached a deal with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to resolve claims it misled five Wisconsin school districts about the risks of sinking $200 million in investment products that were involved in the financial crisis of 2008.

column4: Taiwan stocks near one-week low as Apple suppliers drag
column5: TAIPEI  Sept 9 Taiwan stocks fell to about a one-week low on Friday as TSMC and other Apple Inc  suppliers tracked losses in Apple shares after the iPhone 7 failed to impress Wall Street.

column4: Teva says hoping to launch EpiPen-like device by 2018 in U.S.
column5: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd  said Friday it aims to win U.S. approval by late 2017 or early 2018 for its version of Mylan NV's EpiPen device for treating severe allergic reactions  a move that would challenge the branded product's overwhelming market dominance.

column4: Total sees bargain buy in Chesapeake's Barnett Shale assets
column5: PARIS French oil and gas company Total  will increase its exposure to U.S. shale gas by buying 75 percent of Barnett Shale assets from Chesapeake   taking advantage of a far lower price than it paid for its original 25 percent holding.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 1-Total sees bargain buy in Chesapeake's Barnett Shale assets
column5: PARIS  Sept 9 French oil and gas company Total  will increase its exposure to U.S. shale gas by buying 75 percent of Barnett Shale assets from Chesapeake  taking advantage of a far lower price than it paid for its original 25 percent holding.

column4: Canada regulator says TransCanada pipeline panel to step down
column5: OTTAWA Canada's energy regulator said on Friday that a panel assessing TransCanada Corp's proposed Energy East pipeline was quitting  a decision that will drag out an already-lengthy appraisal process.

column4: UPDATE 4-Canada regulator says TransCanada pipeline panel to step down
column5: OTTAWA  Sept 9 Canada's energy regulator said on Friday that a panel assessing TransCanada Corp's  proposed Energy East pipeline was quitting  a decision that will drag out an already-lengthy appraisal process.

column4: BRIEF-All three members of panel assessing TransCanada Corp's Energy East oil pipeline have stepped down
column5: Sept 9 Canada's energy regulator says all three members of panel assessing Transcanada Corp's Energy East oil pipeline have stepped down

column4: Canada indicates it won't demand regulator change pipeline panel
column5: OTTAWA  Sept 9 Canada on Friday indicated it would not press the country's energy regulator to remove members from a panel looking into Transcanada Corp's proposed Energy East pipeline despite protests over their actions.

column4: BRIEF-UMC's August sales up 6.1 pct y/y
column5: * Says August sales up 6.1 percent y/y at T$12.9 billion  ($411.30 million)

column4: UPDATE 2-Seagate Tech invites ValueAct in as major shareholder
column5: Sept 9 Seagate Technology Plc has invited ValueAct Capital in as an investor  selling a roughly 4 percent stake to the activist hedge fund  which will also get a front-row view of its board meetings  the hard-drive maker said on Friday.

column4: New Asda boss makes first price cuts
column5: LONDON The new boss of Asda  the British supermarket arm of Wal-Mart  introduced his first wave of price cuts on Friday  seeking to reverse a dramatic slump in sales.

column4: Wells Fargo will pay $190 million to settle customer fraud case
column5: WASHINGTON Wells Fargo has long been the envy of the banking industry for its ability to sell multiple products to the same customer  but regulators on Thursday said those practices went too far in some instances. | Video
